    • Method Detail

      • getOrderNumber

        int getOrderNumber()
        This will get the next order number if a new order is being made
        Returns:
        order number of the newest order.

      • getOrders

        List<Order> getOrders​(LocalDate date)
               throws NoSuchOrderFileException
        This method will list all the orders based on the date that has been inputted.
        Parameters:
        date - - the date requested by the user.
        Returns:
        returns all the orders listed from that date.
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - if there is no order to return

      • getOrder

        Order getOrder​(LocalDate date,
               int orderNum)
        throws NoSuchOrderFileException,
               NoSuchOrderException,
               OrderCancelledException
        This method will get a particular order based on the date and the orderNum.
        Parameters:
        date - - the date of the order
        orderNum - - the order number for the order being requested
        Returns:
        - returns the specified order, if it exists
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderException - - if a order cannot be found in an order file
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - if there is no order file with that date
        OrderCancelledException - - if an order has already been cancelled this error will flag it

      • createOrder

        Order createOrder​(Order newOrder)
           throws OrderPersistenceException
        Creates a new order based on the input of the user.
        Parameters:
        newOrder - - new order with details filled out.
        Returns:
        - the created order.
        Throws:
        OrderPersistenceException - - if the file is unable to add the new order to a file

      • editOrder

        void editOrder​(Order editedOrder)
        throws NoSuchOrderFileException,
               OrderPersistenceException
        This method allows for the edited order, done by the user to be inputted into the system.
        Parameters:
        editedOrder - - the newly edited order.
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - in case an order cannot be found
        OrderPersistenceException - - if the file is unable to add the new order to a file

      • exportOrders

        List<Order> exportOrders()
                  throws NoSuchOrderFileException,
                         OrderPersistenceException
        Exports all the orders from order file and those that are still active will be added to the backup file.
        Returns:
        - returns the list of active orders
        Throws:
        NoSuchOrderFileException - - in case an order cannot be found
        OrderPersistenceException - - in case a file cannot be written to

      • getProductList

        List<Product> getProductList()
        This method returns a list of products that are available.
        Returns:
        - returns the list of products.

      • getTaxList

        List<Taxes> getTaxList()
        This method returns a list of taxes per state that are available.
        Returns:
        - returns the list of taxes

      • calculateCosts

        Order calculateCosts​(Order order)
        This method is utilised to calculate the order costs using the user information inputted by the user. Calculates all remaining properties of the order which are listed below: MaterialCost = (Area * CostPerSquareFoot) LaborCost = (Area * LaborCostPerSquareFoot) Tax = (MaterialCost + LaborCost) * (TaxRate/100) Tax rates are stored as whole numbers Total = (MaterialCost + LaborCost + Tax)
        Parameters:
        order - - the current order state without the costs.
        Returns:
        - the updates user details with all the calculations completed.
